name: Adobo
description: Classic Filipino adobo tangy, savory braised pork or chicken.
instructions: Marinate meat with soy sauce and half the garlic for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pot and sauté remaining garlic until fragrant.
Add meat and brown lightly.
Pour in marinade, vinegar, bay leaves, peppercorns and water.
Simmer until tender and sauce reduces (30-45 minutes).
Adjust seasoning; serve with rice.

name: Sinigang na Baboy
description: A sour tamarind soup with pork and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 pack tamarind soup mix (or fresh tamarind)
instructions: Boil pork ribs in water with onion and tomatoes until tender.
Add fish sauce and tamarind mix.
Add eggplant, chilies, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add kangkong leaves last and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Kare-Kare
description: Peanut stew with oxtail, vegetables, and shrimp paste.
instructions: Boil oxtail until tender.
Sauté garlic and onion in oil.
Add annatto seeds in oil for color, then discard seeds.
Add boiled oxtail, peanut butter, and ground peanuts.
Add vegetables and simmer until cooked.
Serve with bagoong (shrimp paste).

name: Lechon
description: Crispy roasted whole pig, a Filipino fiesta specialty.
instructions: Clean and season pig with salt, pepper, soy sauce, and calamansi.
Stuff cavity with lemongrass.
Roast over charcoal, turning constantly, until skin is golden and crispy.
Chop and serve with liver sauce.

name: Pancit Canton
description: Stir-fried egg noodles with meat, shrimp, and vegetables.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion, add pork and cook until browned.
Add shrimp and vegetables, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and 1 cup water.
Toss in noodles until cooked and well coated.
Serve hot with calamansi.

name: Halo-Halo
description: A popular Filipino shaved ice dessert with mixed sweets.
instructions: Layer sweetened fruits and beans in a tall glass.
Add shaved ice on top.
Pour evaporated milk over the ice.
Top with leche flan and ube ice cream.
Mix before eating.

name: Laing
description: Taro leaves cooked in coconut milk and chili peppers.
ingredients: 2 tbsp dried shrimp or fish flakes
instructions: In a pot, combine coconut milk, onion, garlic, and shrimp flakes.
Simmer and add taro leaves (do not stir until leaves soften).
Add chilies and cook until coconut oil comes out.
Top with coconut cream and simmer a few minutes.
Serve with rice.

name: Bicol Express
description: Pork cooked in coconut milk with chili peppers.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion, add pork and cook until browned.
Add shrimp paste and stir well.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer until pork is tender.
Add chilies and coconut cream, cook until thickened.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Sisig
description: Crispy pork face and ears, chopped and served on a sizzling plate.
instructions: Boil pork face until tender, then grill until crispy.
Chop finely and sauté with onions and garlic.
Season with soy sauce and calamansi.
Serve on sizzling plate with raw egg cracked on top.

name: Lumpiang Shanghai
description: Deep-fried spring rolls with pork filling.
instructions: Mix pork, carrot, onion, garlic, egg, salt, and pepper.
Wrap 1 tbsp of filling in spring roll wrapper.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown.
Serve with sweet chili sauce.

name: Bulalo
description: Beef shank soup with bone marrow and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 kg beef shank with bone marrow
instructions: Boil beef shank in water with onion until tender.
Add corn and potatoes, simmer until cooked.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add pechay leaves before serving.

name: Inasal
description: Bacolod-style grilled chicken marinated in calamansi, vinegar, and annatto oil.
instructions: Marinate chicken with calamansi, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Grill over charcoal while basting with annatto oil.
Serve with rice and dipping sauce.

name: Tokwa't Baboy
description: Boiled pork and fried tofu with soy-vinegar sauce.
ingredients: 500 g pork belly, boiled and sliced
instructions: Mix soy sauce, vinegar, onion, garlic, and chili for sauce.
Combine boiled pork and fried tofu.
Pour sauce and toss well before serving.

name: Pinakbet
description: Ilocano mixed vegetables with bagoong.
instructions: Sauté onion and tomato in oil.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add bagoong and simmer until vegetables are tender.
Serve hot.

name: Puto
description: Steamed rice cakes often served as merienda.
instructions: Mix rice flour, sugar, baking powder, and water until smooth.
Pour batter into molds and steam for 20 minutes.
Top with grated cheese before serving.

name: Bibingka
description: Christmas rice cake baked in banana leaves.
ingredients: Grated coconut and cheese for topping
instructions: Line pan with banana leaves.
Mix rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, and eggs into batter.
Pour batter into pan and bake until set.
Top with grated coconut and cheese.

name: Arroz Caldo
description: Comforting Filipino rice porridge flavored with ginger and chicken.
ingredients: Calamansi and boiled egg for garnish
instructions: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Add rice and fish sauce, stir to coat.
Pour chicken broth and simmer until rice is soft.
Serve with boiled egg, calamansi, and fried garlic.

name: Chicken Tinola
description: Light ginger-based chicken soup with papaya and chili leaves.
instructions: Sauté onion and ginger in oil.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in water and simmer until chicken is tender.
Add papaya slices and cook until soft.
Add chili leaves and season with fish sauce before serving.

name: Champorado
description: Sweet chocolate rice porridge often served with dried fish (tuyo).
instructions: Boil glutinous rice in water until half-cooked.
Add cocoa powder and sugar, stir until rice is tender.
Simmer until thick and creamy.
Serve hot with a swirl of evaporated milk.
Optional: eat with tuyo on the side.

name: Turon
description: Crispy fried spring rolls filled with banana and jackfruit.
instructions: Roll banana and jackfruit in sugar.
Wrap in spring roll wrapper and seal edges.
Fry in hot oil until golden and caramelized.
Drain excess oil and serve hot.

name: Longganisa
description: Sweet, garlicky Filipino pork sausage often served with garlic rice and egg (Longsilog).
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground pork, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, paprika, pepper, and salt. Mix well until sticky.
If using casings, stuff mixture into casings and tie into links. Otherwise, shape into small patties or logs and wrap in wax paper.
Refrigerate overnight to allow flavors to develop.
Pan-fry in a little water until it evaporates, then let sausage brown in its own rendered fat.
Serve with garlic fried rice and fried egg (Longsilog).
